title: Senior Technical Specialist - Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.
We are looking for a Senior SOC Analyst who will join our Security Operations Center.
Role Overview:
As a SOC Analyst, you'll be an integral part of our team, responsible for identifying, analyzing, and mitigating cybersecurity incidents to ensure our clients' digital environments are secure and resilient.
Job Description* Ensure the continuous monitoring and review of security event sources for alerts and incidents.
* Use SOC security analytic tools, technologies and services (SIEM, SOAR, EDR etc).
* Perform investigations of security incidents,
* Perform threat Intelligence and threat hunting, to search for new, emerged and wildly exploited threats.
* Develop automation of our detection capabilities.
* Manage and maintain security event monitoring use cases, including ruleset configuration for the deployed toolset.
* Report and participate in process development
* Actively proposing changes or improvements of products/services and.


Requirements
We expect you to have some years of working experience in cybersecurity, as a security analyst or incident responder.
A Swedish citizenship as we have some Swedish security elevated customers
Excellent knowledge of the English language, both spoken and written
Qualifications
We do also expect you to have previous experience within some of the following areas:* Networking technologies (Firewalls, Next-Gen Firewalls, Switches, Routers)
* Endpoint protection (Antivirus / EDR)
* Cloud security knowledge
* Intrusion detection and prevention systems (IPS/IDS sensors)
* Security Information and Event Management (SIEM platforms)
* Vulnerability scanning
* Penetration testing / Ethical hacking
* Scripting languages


We consider it meritorious if you have any cybersecurity or it operations related certificates  

As a person you are:
A team player who is also capable of working with independent tasks. You have a passion for IT and especially for security. With us, you will have the opportunity to directly influence your career development and the future of our SOC. We value good ideas and implement these. We believe that trust fosters freedom and creativity. Our culture is built on transparency and active sharing – a truly open environment.
Are you interested?
We look forward your application!  

Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we’ll reach out to you. Interviews will be held on continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today.*We perform background checks on all final candidates.**Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*
About Tietoevry
Tietoevry is one of the leading companies in the Nordics building better digital services for our clients both on private and public sectors. With us, you are part of the forefront of emerging businesses and technology making the difference with our customers. Cooperate and exchange ideas with professionals in an international and evolving working environment. Increase your knowledge in a variety of areas, you set the limit. Our culture is built on transparency and active sharing – a truly open environment.
#LI-JX1
#LI-Hybrid
At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Technology Product Manager
description:
At Wolters Kluwer, the Product Manager plays a pivotal role, with overall accountability and decision-making authority throughout the product development process. You will gain a deep understanding of our customers, potential clients, and the broader industry landscape, using this knowledge to shape innovative solutions. In this role, you will proactively identify and overcome challenges while exercising independent judgment and working with minimal supervision.
As a member of our Scandinavian Product Management Team, you will closely collaborate with product specialists, software developers, local business teams, and other stakeholders to drive our ambitious cloud product strategy forward.
Key Responsibilities:* Serve as the primary liaison between business teams and Product Management.
* Lead product planning, strategy, and prioritization in close cooperation with teams across countries.
* Take the lead on specific cross-Scandinavian portfolio areas.
* Identify and explore opportunities for business development within the Wolters Kluwer model portfolio, with a Scandinavian focus.
* Own the commercial and market fit of assigned products.
* Prepare business cases, working with stakeholders across multiple countries and functions.
* Manage partnerships and oversee responsibilities for assigned partner products.
* Support marketing, sales, and customer success teams in go-to-market strategies and product onboarding.


Requirements:* Proven experience as a Product Manager with strong business acumen and relevant experience within a software company.
* Solid knowledge of the accounting and tax advisory industry, with expertise in practice management and advisory services.
* A technical and development-oriented mindset, with experience working alongside large clients in business development.
* Familiarity with agile methodologies, particularly the SAFe Agile Development Framework, is an advantage.
* You are naturally curious and thrive in a collaborative environment with multiple stakeholders across Scandinavia and Europe.
* Willingness to travel across Scandinavian countries is essential for success in this position.


What We Offer:
We believe in rewarding our team with a competitive benefits package, including a collective agreement that covers occupational pension, health benefits, food vouchers, and more. We offer flexible working hours and recognize the importance of work-life balance, providing extra days off and early finish times during the summer.
At Wolters Kluwer, you will be part of a team of dedicated, professional, and friendly colleagues. We foster an open and inclusive work environment where collaboration is key.
We believe in supporting personal and professional growth. Our core values—Win as a Team, Make It Better, Customer Focus, and Aim High and Deliver—guide everything we do. Here, your contributions will be recognized, and you’ll have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact.
Interested?
If you have any questions or would like more information, feel free to reach out to our recruiter, Silvie Roelans, at silvie.roelans@wolterskluwer.com or + 47 466 72 863

title: Senior Hardware Design Engineer
description:
Senior Hardware Design Engineer


Swedium Global is the growing System Engineering and Solution Company, offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web and Cloud Application Development, Testing Services, Consultancy and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model. Swedium Global is having presence in Sweden, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic and in India.


**Location:** Sweden


**Expected Start date:** ASAP


**Job Name**: **Senior** **Hardware Design Engineer**

  

  

**Assignment description**


We are now looking for a **Hardware Design Engineer** for an onsite project in Sweden.


**Purpose of Position:**


Strengthen a medical device development project, as well as owning the electronics of a product on the market. Act as Hardware Engineer and be an integral part of a tight team responsible for the hardware and embedded system of the products.


Cooperate with other electronics engineers, system engineers, software developers and testers to ensure a stable, safe and efficient product.


**Key Accountabilities:**


* Own the electronic components in a new medical device development project.
* Identify and evaluate alternative design solutions, including component selection, prototyping and testing.
* Develop and own the technical documentation for the electronics in a medical device such as:


**Requirement specifications**

* Design Failure Mode and Effect Analysis (DFMEA)


* Component specifications


* Plan and coordinate activities related to HW development.
* Conduct reviews of electrical schematics and PCB designs.
* Lead efforts for compliance testing against medical standards, EMC, ESD and Radio.
* Develop test methods and perform analysis such as single-fault condition testing according to medical standards.
* Specify and develop production test.
* Own and maintain the electronic components and documentation of a medical device on the market.


﻿  

  



**Qualifications and Experience:**


* More than 5 years of experience in embedded systems electronics
* Experience from medical device industry
* Proven knowledge in IEC 60601
* Hands on experience of technical documentation for medical electronic equipment
* Experience from certification of medical electronic equipment
* Proven track record of electronics design including analogue and digital circuits
* Knowledge of design for manufacturability, production test and preferably experience of working with contract manufacturing
* Experience of battery-operated devices
* Academic background in engineering (bachelor’s or master’s degree) preferably within the field of electronics﻿


**You can reach out to us at** **Pratik.pandey@swediumglobal.com** **or** **hr@swediumglobal.com**

title: Regulatory Liaison Counsel - tax compliance
description:
**Build your future with Sovos.**



If you're seeking a career where innovation meets impact, you've come to the right place. As a global leader, Sovos is transforming tax compliance from a business requirement to a force for growth while revolutionising how businesses navigate the ever-changing regulatory landscape.



At Sovos, we're dedicated to more than just solving compliance challenges – we're committed to making a positive and lasting difference in everything we do. Our teams operate on the modern edge of digital technology, working not only to solve complex business challenges but also to enrich our personal, professional, and local communities.



Our purpose-built systems provide the tools you need to thrive in a world where governments demand increased visibility, faster reporting and greater control over business processes. Excited about the possibilities? So are we!



Don’t worry if you don't check all the boxes – apply anyway! We're focused on hiring the right people, not just the "right" resume. It's not about what you've done elsewhere; it's all about what you're capable of doing here.

  


**The Work You'll Do:**



The Regulatory Liaison Counsel - ISVs and Embedded Partners will play a critical role in supporting and growing Sovos’ global ISV ecosystem and revenue stream by engaging with the Sovos partner ecosystem and supporting their needs as they look to Sovos for ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements in their solution portfolios and customer implementations. This position combines the expertise of a Regulatory Counsel, requiring deep knowledge and ongoing involvement in the processes of the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, with the role of a liaison officer dedicated to facilitating partners’ access to the broader regulatory function within Sovos. This role reports to the VP of Regulatory Analysis and Design.


*More specifically you will:*



* The Regulatory Liaison Counsel is responsible for bridging the gap between Sovos' regulatory expertise and its strategic ISV partners, ensuring seamless integration of relevant compliance aspects of Sovos solutions in various markets.
* Partner closely with Sovos functions managing the business and technical aspects of relationships with ISV partners to ensure satisfaction of partners’ compliance needs within the scope of Sovos software solutions.
* Maintain accountability for a ‘regulatory helpdesk SLA’ that allows Sovos partners to act with confidence, ensuring timely and appropriate Sovos regulatory input towards their customers.
* Ensure a deep understanding of Sovos Regulatory Affairs and broader interaction with public authorities on an ongoing basis.
* Work continuously with Sovos Alliances, Sales Engineering, Product Management, and other relevant functions to develop and maintain a robust understanding of Sovos’ partner ecosystem and the specific business processes and associated compliance needs that arise in that context.
* Represent the requirements of Sovos ISV and embedded partners in the evolving scope and day-to-day execution of regulatory monitoring, design, and affairs in close collaboration with colleagues in the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, as well as with Regulatory Affairs, Business Analysts, Product Managers, and other Sovos colleagues involved in designing, building, implementing, supporting, and maintaining Sovos solutions.
* Act as an integral part of the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, internalizing contextual and factual knowledge that allows the Regulatory Liaison Counsel to act as independently as possible in their key role towards Sovos partners while also maintaining an excellent understanding of roles, responsibilities, and time allocation for partner support within the larger Regulatory Analysis and Design Department.
* Support the VP of Regulatory Analysis and Design and their teams to ensure optimization of resources in support of all relevant Sovos functions and help them with time and resource planning towards that goal.
* Explain complex tax rules in clear language for both tax and non-tax professionals, internally and externally.
* Support Partner Marketing by providing tax-centric marketing material and participating in webinars.
* In collaboration with Sovos Marketing and partner management functions, participate as a Sovos regulatory thought leader and subject matter expert in Partner events, advisory boards, and publications.
  

**What We Need From You**


* Juris Doctor (JD) degree or equivalent master’s degree in law, finance, or accounting.
* Proficiency in legislative tracking and tax research techniques.
* Experience in working within and a deep understanding of the enterprise software market, including the value-add of different categories of enterprise software to size and geographic segments in the business sector.
* Experience in working with and deep understanding of businesses’ financial, logistical, administrative, and IT processes and strategies.
* A strong affinity for and proven ability to communicate effectively with professionals in information technology, data science, and computer-assisted business processes.
* Strong team orientation with a history of working collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent research, analysis, and writing skills.
* Ability to read, interpret, and understand tax-related postings and documents.
* Ability to generate and interpret functional and high-level technical design content as it pertains to compliance and business processes.
* Self-motivated with a strong drive to succeed.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize activities.
* Additional language skills are strongly preferred.
* Minimal travel required to Sovos locations and events.

  



**What Does Sovos Offer You?**


The tools to enhance your life - because we want you to enjoy your life outside of work and inside!


* An opportunity to work with a global team
* Bi-Weekly Meeting Free Days!
* Mentoring Programs
* Globally recognised Training and Development programs
* Benefits

*Sovos is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an environment that celebrates diversity and where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate against race, colour, religions, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic provided by law. At Sovos, all employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work.*


**Company Background**


Sovos is a global provider of tax, compliance and trust solutions and services that enable businesses to navigate an increasingly regulated world with true confidence. Purpose-built for always-on compliance capabilities, our scalable IT-driven solutions meet the demands of an evolving and complex global regulatory landscape. Sovos’ cloud-based software platform provides an unparalleled level of integration with business applications and government compliance processes.


More than 100,000 customers in 100+ countries – including half the Fortune 500 – trust Sovos for their compliance needs. Sovos annually processes more than three billion transactions across 19,000 global tax jurisdictions. Bolstered by a robust partner program more than 400 strong, Sovos brings to bear an unrivaled global network for companies across industries and geographies. Founded in 1979, Sovos has operations across the Americas and Europe, and is owned by Hg and TA Associates. For more information visit http://www.sovos.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.
company_description: Sovos is a global SaaS company capable of meeting your regulatory compliance needs anywhere you do business.

title: Engineering Manager - Sound
description:
At Epidemic Sound, we make soundtracking content simple and inspiring with unlimited access to music and sound effects. Headquartered in Stockholm, with offices all over the world, we are a force of over 500 on a mission to soundtrack the world. Our innovative licensing model paves the way for creators - from YouTubers to small businesses to the world’s most recognizable brands such as Netflix, Redbull and BBC - to use sound to enhance their content while simultaneously supporting artists both financially and creatively. Epidemic Sound music is heard 2 billion times a day on YouTube alone and is recognized as one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies by the Financial Times. Epidemic Sound is backed by EQT, Blackstone, Creandum, Atwater Capital to name a few.
  
  

We are looking for an experienced Engineering Manager to lead one of our core services teams, focused on the music area. This is a critical role where you will oversee personnel, delivery, processes, and cross-team technical collaboration. You’ll be working with one of our core domains - managing the systems that ingest, manage, and distribute the music provided by our artists.
  
The team contributes value through track taxonomy development, building efficient administrative tools, integrating with sound providers (such as Spotify), and developing platform functionality for other teams to access our extensive sounds library. Currently, the team is enhancing its metadata model to prepare our music catalog for exciting future applications.
  
In this role, you’ll have a significant influence on how the team operates, defining the technical roadmap and target architecture. You will be managing a diverse and dynamic team and your leadership will be key in fostering a high level of psychological safety and cultivating team members across all levels of seniority.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Lead and support the team in development processes and practices such as attending standups, mob programming, and facilitating design sessions.
  
  

Conduct 1:1s to guide team members’ growth, improving their skills, team dynamics, and career progression.
  
  

Collaborate closely with the Product Manager and stakeholders to ensure sustainable, high-quality software delivery at a fast pace.
  
  

Own the engineering plan concerning security, legacy, capacity, and quality.
  
  

Manage cross-team technical deliveries and communication.
  
  

**Who You Are:**  

An experienced leader capable of coaching and growing a team of engineers, from junior to senior levels.
  
  

A strategic thinker who can create a vision for the team and turn it into reality.
  
  

Someone who thrives on collaboration, working closely with the Product Manager and other stakeholders to ensure company-wide alignment.
  
  

A decision-maker who can lead through coaching but knows when to step in to make key decisions.
  
  

**Must-Have Qualifications:**  

Strong technical background with expertise in modern agile software development practices and cloud technology.
  
  

Proven experience managing and growing engineering teams.
  
  

Solid understanding of system design, architecture, and team dynamics.
  
  

Ability to build a psychologically safe work environment for your team.
  
  

**Nice-to-Have Qualifications:**  

Experience in the music industry and/or sound production.
  
  

Familiarity with Kotlin/Python, GCP, BigQuery and experience working in a modern, product-driven company.
  
  

Join us and be part of a central team, where your work will directly impact the core of Epidemic Sound's business and shape the future of sound production and management!
  
**Equal Opportunity Employer:** We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
  
ApplicationDo you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.

title: Juniora Analysts till Operations, Engineering, AI & Data (Stockholm) - Jan 2025
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
-----------------------

Deloitte är en globalt ledande leverantör av Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal och Consultative Services. Med mer än 457 000 medarbetare i över 150 länder hjälper vi våra klienter och vår omvärld att lösa komplexa problem och nå högt uppsatta mål. Det som definierar Deloitte är vår strävan efter att göra en meningsfull skillnad. För oss innebär det långsiktig utveckling och resultat för våra klienter och deras företag, idéer och handlingar, som också bidrar till en positiv samhällsutveckling. Det handlar även om att stärka våra medarbetare och främja deras utveckling.


**Om rollen**
-------------

Operations, Engineering, AI & Data stödjer våra klienter i att driva strategiska förändringsprojekt där vi implementerar affärsstrategier och utvecklar deras operationella förmågor för att hjälpa dem nå sina affärsmål. Vi arbetar med verksamhetsförändring där vi använder våra industrispecifika lösningar och tekniska kunskap för att transformera, modernisera och optimera våra klienters processer och tekniska plattformar.


**AI & Data:**

AI & Data-teamet hjälper våra kunder att förbättra beslutsfattande genom datadrivna insikter och skapa insiktsdrivna organisationer med hjälp av AI, analytics och data. Teamet arbetar med teknisk implementering av lösningar inom AI, GenAI, cloud data platforms, data warehouse, BI/analytics samt datakataloger och hantering av masterdata, men också med rådgivning inom dessa områden. Detta innefattar data och AI strategi samt -governance. Vår modell är on-the-job-training där du växer in i mer ansvarsfulla roller, men du kommer också att vidareutbilda dig i olika tekniska plattformar, t.ex. Google Cloud Platform, AWS, Azure, Snowflake och/eller Databricks. AI & Data-teamet verkar i en nordisk organisation med mycket kunskapskapital och kompetens så du kommer också att medverka i projekt, communities och utbildningar tillsammans med dina nordiska kollegor.


**Operations, Industry & Domain Solutions:**

Vi hjälper våra kunder att på ett innovativt sätt förändra sina organisationer. Detta kan innebära att driva större och mindre förändringsprojekt, förnya sin operativa modell, implementera nya system och processer eller förbättra sin effektivitet. Vårt team fokuserar primärt på bank- och försäkring där vi arbetar tillsammans med flertalet av Nordens största banker och försäkringsbolag, samt hälso- och sjukvårdssektorn.


Vi arbetar ofta ihop i projektteam med en stark laganda, där du som Analyst spelar en viktig roll och arbetar nära kunden. Som Analyst kommer du att driva analysarbete, stötta i framtagandet av presentationsmaterial och tillsammans med ditt team hjälpa kunden att lyckas med sin förändringsresa. Du får möjlighet att arbeta nära och lära dig av våra erfarna kollegor om olika industrier och hur man arbetar med affärsutveckling, och inte minst hjälpa våra kunder att adressera spännande tekniska och affärsmässiga utmaningar.


**Engineering:**

Hos Engineering-teamet kommer ditt fokus ligga på att stärka våra kunders helhetsresa genom att leverera plattforms- och Cloudfunktioner, samt hjälpa våra kunder se transformation som en affärsmöjlighet och konkurrensfördel på marknaden. Vi utnyttjar vår tekniska expertis inom specifika branschsektorer och domänledda approacher för att skapa fördelar för våra kunder genom unika tjänster, produkter och lösningar. Vårt erbjudande inkluderar utveckling av strategier, migrationsplanering, modernisering av applikationer samt utveckling av plattformar och produkter.


Som Analyst i vårt team kommer du att vara en del av våra kunders resa genom att stötta vid framtagande av presentationsmaterial och bidra till utveckling av strategier, delta i kundmöten samt göra research. Du kommer att skaffa dig erfarenhet både genom kundprojekt men även genom att delta vid branschevent, specialiserad utbildning och certifieringsprogram.


**Kravspecifikation**
---------------------

Vi söker dig som är nyexaminerad ingenjör eller ekonom med en masterexamen inom management, data/data science/analytics eller finans. För att trivas bra i rollen bör du även vara utåtriktad och initiativrik samt drivs av nya utmaningar.


Vidare ser vi gärna att du innehar:


* Goda studieresultat, internationell erfarenhet och relevant engagemang vid sidan av studierna
* Relevant arbetslivserfarenhet – erfarenhet från konsultbranschen är meriterande
* Mycket goda språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
* Förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och tillsammans i ett team, med målmedvetenhet, engagemang och driv
* Intresse för hur digitalisering och ny teknik kan utveckla verksamheter och branscher

Om du är osäker på om du uppfyller ovan kvalifikationer uppmuntrar vi dig att skicka in en ansökan ändå.


**Ytterligare information**
---------------------------

**Vi erbjuder**

Som en del av Deloitte får du tillgång till världens största konsultnätverk med kollegor världen över som du kan nyttja för att utveckla både dig själv, våra klienter och vår verksamhet. Du får arbeta med spännande, komplexa uppdrag, både på global och nordisk nivå, i ett team som alltid värderar ditt perspektiv och som är i framkant av digitaliseringen. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att erbjuda dig möjligheter att driva din personliga utveckling. Vi erbjuder dig praktisk erfarenhet, en personlig coach som långsiktigt stöttar dig i din karriär samt kontinuerlig feedback och support från mer erfarna kollegor.


Du får möjlighet att arbeta i ett företag som hjälper andra aktörer i deras resa mot en mer hållbar organisation, samtidigt som vi arbetar målmedvetet med våra egna ambitioner inom både klimat, miljö och socialt ansvar. Vi ser ett värde i att våra medarbetare har olika erfarenheter vilket främjar nytänkande och bidrar till fler perspektiv.


**Ansökan**

Du ansöker online. Din ansökan ska bestå av:


* CV
* En motivering till;
	+ Varför du är intresserad av Deloitte och rollen
	+ Vad du tror att du kan tillföra i rollen
* Betygskopior från högskola/universitet - De betyg som du laddar upp bör inte vara utdragna senare än 2 månader tillbaka i tiden.

Ladda gärna upp din motivering och dina betyg som ett dokument. CV laddas upp i första steget och de övriga dokumenten som efterfrågas laddas upp när du går vidare till nästa steg (ej i kommentarsfältet). Notera att du behöver ladda upp samtliga dokument för att din ansökan ska ses som fullständig. Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt då vi arbetar med löpande urval.


Som ett kvalitativt led i Deloittes rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om våra framtida medarbetare, trygga arbetsmiljön för våra medarbetare och möta regelkrav. Processen för bakgrundskontroller genomförs i samarbete med ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/sv/faq/ . För de tjänster som Deloitte efterfrågar universitetsbetyg genomförs en verifiering som en del i rekryteringsprocessen. För frågor hänvisar vi till ansvarig rekryterare i processen.


**Frågor**

Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller om rekryteringsprocessen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Maria Brengdahl Bengtsson, mbrengdahlbengtsson@deloitte.se .


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!


**What impact will you make?**

På Deloitte gör ditt arbete en meningsfull skillnad, varje dag, medan du växer i en inkluderande företagskultur av samarbete och hög prestation. Utöver att skapa lösningar strävar vi efter att göra en positiv och avgörande skillnad för andra i vår omgivning, våra klienter och samhället. På Deloitte hittar du tidigare dolda möjligheter att lyckas och inser din fulla potential.


**Arbetsplats**
---------------
company_description: We’re a leading professional services firm, but what makes working at Deloitte unique? When you join us, you become connected. To inspiring people. To meaningful work with fascinating clients.

title: Cybersecurity Expert - Volvo Group Connected Solutions
description:
Do you want to be part of a global organization leading the development of the Volvo Group’s connected services and solutions? For us “connected for efficiency, sustainability and safety” is much more than a tagline. If this sounds interesting to you, keep on reading!

  

At Volvo Group Connected Solutions we work at the forefront of connectivity with data from over 1 000 000 Volvo Group customer assets. Together with customers, partners, and the Volvo Group we create real value, not only for our customers but also for society at large.

  

We are now looking for an IT Security & Risk Officer to join our Cybersecurity department within Architecture & Security.

**This is us, your new colleagues**
-----------------------------------


Architecture & Security is newly formed, and we aim to set and evolve enterprise architecture, cybersecurity and privacy compliance via vision, strategy, tactics, and operational support. Through this we want to make sure that we have optimal architecture, technology solutions, and ways of working in area of connectivity to drive value for Volvo Group and our Customers in a secure and compliant way. We believe that by applying lean governance in a cross functional cooperation model, we can ensure insight in the current, the right decisions, and continuously improve efficiency while minimizing risk. One of our main tasks is to lead and continuously improve the area of cybersecurity at Connected Solutions to proactively reduce business risks from security related events. We bring people, processes, and technology together to protect against digital attacks and the constantly evolving nature of security risks.

 **The role**

  

As an IT Security & Risk Officer at Connected Solutions you will work cross functional within Volvo Group Connected Solutions and other parts of Volvo Group. You will get the opportunity to further strengthen the Cybersecurity department and information security practices at Connected Solutions. Our scope is wide and stretches from security strategies to risk assessment and penetration testing.

**Your profile**
----------------


We like to see that you have experience in areas such as development of governance frameworks, threat analysis and risk assessments, security by design and architecture, in cloud and hybrid infrastructure environments, cryptography, security auditing, incident & response, crisis management or forensic investigations as well as standardizations within the automotive industry. And if you have been working in an agile delivery environment this is a bonus.

  

We believe that you have operational experience from working in a global business environment. Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, personal credibility, integrity and creativity are crucial personal characteristics. You are a social person with strong relationship capabilities, have good communication skills and enjoy working with others in flexible team constellations. You are a doer, driver and a motivator for the entire organization. You have a passion for business, technology and information security.

  

You have a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent as the basis for your career. Working proficiency in the English language, both speech and writing, is a requirement. The successful candidate will have shown a get it done-attitude and great persona in combination with a strong track record and references.

  

You will be part of a professional security network at the Volvo Group, getting the chance to exchange ideas and solutions with skilled peers on a regular basis.

 **What we can offer you**

  

You will be part of a team that creates great results through amazing people, strong relationships, and a high-performance culture. We are a team that lead and continuously improve the area of Cybersecurity at Connected Solutions to proactively reduce business risks from security related events. We who work in this team have a lot of fun and we all have a true passion to really make a difference.

  

Our main hub and headquarter is in Lindholmen Science Park in Gothenburg, a vibrant area that lives and breathes new technology like IoT, autonomous driving, electro mobility and digitalization.

  

Welcome to the heart of connectivity at Volvo Group Connected Solutions!

**For more information please contact:**
----------------------------------------


Sofia Skoglund, Director Cybersecurity, +46 76 5534054

  

Last application date for this posting is 6th October 2024.

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

At **Volvo Group Connected Solutions** we drive transportation forward through connectivity. Our services and solutions are the key to a connected and more productive infrastructure, to ensure safer transport and reduced carbon emissions. By leveraging massive amounts of data from our customers connected assets, we are leading the way in a rapidly changing industry.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Tax Compliance Regulatory Counsel - Partner management
description:
**Build your future with Sovos.**



If you're seeking a career where innovation meets impact, you've come to the right place. As a global leader, Sovos is transforming tax compliance from a business requirement to a force for growth while revolutionising how businesses navigate the ever-changing regulatory landscape.



At Sovos, we're dedicated to more than just solving compliance challenges – we're committed to making a positive and lasting difference in everything we do. Our teams operate on the modern edge of digital technology, working not only to solve complex business challenges but also to enrich our personal, professional, and local communities.



Our purpose-built systems provide the tools you need to thrive in a world where governments demand increased visibility, faster reporting and greater control over business processes. Excited about the possibilities? So are we!



Don’t worry if you don't check all the boxes – apply anyway! We're focused on hiring the right people, not just the "right" resume. It's not about what you've done elsewhere; it's all about what you're capable of doing here.

  


**The Work You'll Do:**



The Regulatory Liaison Counsel - ISVs and Embedded Partners will play a critical role in supporting and growing Sovos’ global ISV ecosystem and revenue stream by engaging with the Sovos partner ecosystem and supporting their needs as they look to Sovos for ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements in their solution portfolios and customer implementations. This position combines the expertise of a Regulatory Counsel, requiring deep knowledge and ongoing involvement in the processes of the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, with the role of a liaison officer dedicated to facilitating partners’ access to the broader regulatory function within Sovos. This role reports to the VP of Regulatory Analysis and Design.


*More specifically you will:*



* The Regulatory Liaison Counsel is responsible for bridging the gap between Sovos' regulatory expertise and its strategic ISV partners, ensuring seamless integration of relevant compliance aspects of Sovos solutions in various markets.
* Partner closely with Sovos functions managing the business and technical aspects of relationships with ISV partners to ensure satisfaction of partners’ compliance needs within the scope of Sovos software solutions.
* Maintain accountability for a ‘regulatory helpdesk SLA’ that allows Sovos partners to act with confidence, ensuring timely and appropriate Sovos regulatory input towards their customers.
* Ensure a deep understanding of Sovos Regulatory Affairs and broader interaction with public authorities on an ongoing basis.
* Work continuously with Sovos Alliances, Sales Engineering, Product Management, and other relevant functions to develop and maintain a robust understanding of Sovos’ partner ecosystem and the specific business processes and associated compliance needs that arise in that context.
* Represent the requirements of Sovos ISV and embedded partners in the evolving scope and day-to-day execution of regulatory monitoring, design, and affairs in close collaboration with colleagues in the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, as well as with Regulatory Affairs, Business Analysts, Product Managers, and other Sovos colleagues involved in designing, building, implementing, supporting, and maintaining Sovos solutions.
* Act as an integral part of the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, internalizing contextual and factual knowledge that allows the Regulatory Liaison Counsel to act as independently as possible in their key role towards Sovos partners while also maintaining an excellent understanding of roles, responsibilities, and time allocation for partner support within the larger Regulatory Analysis and Design Department.
* Support the VP of Regulatory Analysis and Design and their teams to ensure optimization of resources in support of all relevant Sovos functions and help them with time and resource planning towards that goal.
* Explain complex tax rules in clear language for both tax and non-tax professionals, internally and externally.
* Support Partner Marketing by providing tax-centric marketing material and participating in webinars.
* In collaboration with Sovos Marketing and partner management functions, participate as a Sovos regulatory thought leader and subject matter expert in Partner events, advisory boards, and publications.
  

**What We Need From You**


* Juris Doctor (JD) degree or equivalent master’s degree in law, finance, or accounting.
* Proficiency in legislative tracking and tax research techniques.
* Experience in working within and a deep understanding of the enterprise software market, including the value-add of different categories of enterprise software to size and geographic segments in the business sector.
* Experience in working with and deep understanding of businesses’ financial, logistical, administrative, and IT processes and strategies.
* A strong affinity for and proven ability to communicate effectively with professionals in information technology, data science, and computer-assisted business processes.
* Strong team orientation with a history of working collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent research, analysis, and writing skills.
* Ability to read, interpret, and understand tax-related postings and documents.
* Ability to generate and interpret functional and high-level technical design content as it pertains to compliance and business processes.
* Self-motivated with a strong drive to succeed.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize activities.
* Additional language skills are strongly preferred.
* Minimal travel required to Sovos locations and events.

  



**What Does Sovos Offer You?**


The tools to enhance your life - because we want you to enjoy your life outside of work and inside!


* An opportunity to work with a global team
* Flexible within the UK, Germany, Sweden, Netherlands, or Portugal.
* Bi-Weekly Meeting Free Days!
* Mentoring Programs
* Globally recognised Training and Development programs
* Benefits

*Sovos is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an environment that celebrates diversity and where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate against race, colour, religions, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic provided by law. At Sovos, all employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work.*


**Company Background**


Sovos is a global provider of tax, compliance and trust solutions and services that enable businesses to navigate an increasingly regulated world with true confidence. Purpose-built for always-on compliance capabilities, our scalable IT-driven solutions meet the demands of an evolving and complex global regulatory landscape. Sovos’ cloud-based software platform provides an unparalleled level of integration with business applications and government compliance processes.


More than 100,000 customers in 100+ countries – including half the Fortune 500 – trust Sovos for their compliance needs. Sovos annually processes more than three billion transactions across 19,000 global tax jurisdictions. Bolstered by a robust partner program more than 400 strong, Sovos brings to bear an unrivaled global network for companies across industries and geographies. Founded in 1979, Sovos has operations across the Americas and Europe, and is owned by Hg and TA Associates. For more information visit http://www.sovos.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.
company_description: Sovos is a global SaaS company capable of meeting your regulatory compliance needs anywhere you do business.

title: Team Manager for CIS Nordics Azure Team
description:
**Do you see the potential in people? Would you like to help us develop our most important assets? In Capgemini Cloud Infrastructure Service (CIS) unit we’re looking for a Team Manager to our Nordics Azure Team. If you’re motivated by a role that combines own consulting work and people management, please read on. You may be the one we’re looking for!**

**Be Inspired**  

**You will be a Team Manager for an Azure team based in the Nordics region. The team consists of people within client delivery roles such as Cloud Engineers and Cloud Architects that are specialized in Azure Infrastructure. The Team Manager role will be combined with a role in client consulting, hence experience from consultancy work within the Azure Infrastructure is mandatory.**  

  

**In your Team Manager role, you will be responsible for:**  

* **Leading and motivating the team**
* **Performance Management**
* **Employability and Utilization**
* **Competence development**
* **Recruiting and growing the team**
* **Cooperation with our market units, Center of Excellence and across our practices**

  

**Be Challenged**  

**You are passionate about leading and developing people. You have previous experience of people management in an international context or a strong will to develop in this direction.**  

  

**You believe in yourself and have the network needed to identify and recruit talents and drive sales with customers. As a person you are structured, driven, committed and customer oriented. You are able to work efficiently and balance operational and strategic goals for your team.**  

  

**You have full working proficiency in both Swedish and English.**  

  

**Be Valued**  

**Capgemini is no better than its people. As a Team Manager you develop our people to ensure our business. You get rewarded by seeing your people grow in capability and in spirit.**
company_description: Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology.

title: Consultant Sales Manager
description:
- For 20 years, Devoteam Gcloud Sweden has been a reliable partner in cloud technology.


As the premier Google EMEA Partner, we have cultivated a robust presence with a dedicated team of 40 professionals in Stockholm and an expansive network of 10,000 team members across Europe. 2024 marks a significant year for us as we embark on an aggressive growth plan, particularly for our Swedish operations.

  
**Role Overview:**  

  

We are looking for a **Consultant Sales Manager** to join our Stockholm team. This role is vital in maintaining and expanding our consultancy services. A key part of your role will be to utilize our existing relationships and customer base to develop our services further.


**Key Responsibilities:**

* Leverage our strong ties with Google and our 500+ customer base to enhance our consultancy services.
* Engage in hands-on sales activities, including booking and leading client meetings.
* Craft and implement inventive sales strategies that align with our aggressive growth plans for 2024.
* Collaborate and educate a proactive sales team, instilling a culture of creativity, innovation, and excellence.
* Collaborate with diverse teams to ensure a unified and forward-thinking approach in the market.
* Stay informed on industry trends and competitor movements to dynamically adapt our strategies.

  
* With extensive years of experience in sales leadership, preferably in the IT consultants, technology or cloud services sector.
* Proven ability to manage client relationships and develop business networks.
* Strong communication skills, fluent in Swedish and English.
* Strategic thinking with an emphasis on practical and effective solutions.
* Leadership skills to support and develop a team in a dynamic environment.

  
- **We Offer:**


	* A key role in a well-established and growing company.
	* A professional and supportive work environment.
	* Opportunities for personal and professional development.
	* Attractive remuneration package, complemented by a competitive benefits scheme.
	* A rewarding sales and profit-sharing incentive model, aligning individual success with company performance.
	* An inclusive and respectful workplace culture.
