title: Senior Sales Executive/KAM
description:
**About Toll Group**
 At Toll, we do more than just logistics - we move the businesses that move the world. Our 16,000 team members can help solve any logistics, transport, or supply chain challenge – big or small. We have been supporting our customers for more than 130 years. Today, we support more than 20,000 customers worldwide with 500 sites in 27 markets, and a forwarding network spanning 150 countries. We are proudly part of Japan Post — www.tollgroup.com
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 We have an exciting opportunity for a strategic Senior Sales Executive to join our team in Stockholm. We are looking to hire an executive who is hungry for success and eager to grow our business, willing to drive the sales and develop new and existing business. This role requires excellent interpersonal skills for working closely with our clients and other departments within Toll.
   

  

* Analyze and identify target customers to boost gross profit and volumes
* Convert sales leads to gross profit in line with objectives
* Develop the product mix between Ocean, Air, and others
* Meet with new clients and conduct qualified sales visits as scheduled
* Provide accurate and timely information to client services and operations for efficiency
* Deliver market feedback to enhance TGF’s market offerings
* Ensure high reliability and consistency in service delivery, making it easier for clients to do business with Toll
* Prepare and deliver presentations, proposals, and tender responses to secure new business


**What You’ll Need To Succeed**
* In-depth knowledge of freight forwarding requirements, market, and regulations
* Exceptional selling and presentation skills, with experience in diverse cultural environments
* Thorough understanding of industry regulations
* Fluent in written and spoken Swedish and English
* Strong existing client relationships
* Commercially focused and results-oriented
* Prepare and deliver presentations, proposals, and tender responses to secure new business
* Participate in the implementation of new products/business to ensure proper processes


**What moves you?**
 At Toll, you can help play a vital role in delivering what matters. From food, fuel, medicine and rescue services, we keep businesses and communities thriving. Every day brings change. We see that as an opportunity. To be curious. To ask the right questions. And build meaningful connections. Because finding new ways to solve problems is what we do. With a bold vision to expand our global reach, our 16,000+ people bring a passion for progress. We collaborate in friendly, caring teams, supported by approachable leaders who give us the autonomy to quickly make decisions with impact. Learn and grow with industry-leading training, alongside talented experts. Feel empowered to take on diverse challenges and new responsibilities to move you, our customers, and our world further.
   

  

 Are you excited about this role but are concerned you don’t meet all the requirements? If you have similar skills and are willing to learn then we encourage you to apply anyway. We know that some people hesitate to apply for jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Toll, we value a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re interested in this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly then please talk to us – you may be just the right candidate for this or other roles we have coming up.
   

  

 At Toll everyone is welcome including those of all ages, ethnicities, genders and abilities.
   

  

 To find out more about us visit www.careers.tollgroup.com
   

  

 You must be entitled to work in the European Union and be prepared to participate in pre-employment checks

title: Data/Software Engineer
description:
**Who We Are:**
 Schibsted Media is the largest media group in Scandinavia including world-class media houses like VG and Aftonbladet.
   

  

 The Data Platform team is a part of the Data & AI division, centrally positioned within Schibsted Media, and committed to driving innovation and delivering exceptional value. Our mission is to establish Schibsted as a data-driven pioneer. Our main responsibility is collecting and distributing behavioural data across all of Schibsted Media by developing and maintaining Pulse - our in-house behavioural data streaming and management system. We serve billions of events daily with minimum latency to ensure our newsrooms always have the latest information at their fingertips. We also have plans to develop a new data platform based on the latest data technologies that will serve as a fundament for Schibsted Media’s Data Mesh.
   

  

**The Role:**
 We are looking for a Data Engineer who has completed more than a few features together with their team and is also respectfully proactive in taking ownership of and investigating the “whys” of things.
   

  

 What you’ll do:
   

  

* Design and implement highly scalable applications and data pipelines for the Schibsted Media Data Platform - always working in pairs or small groups.
* Maintain, monitor and optimise existing data pipelines to ensure smooth and continuous operations 24/7.
* Working in week-long on-call shifts no more than once a month.
* Assist our internal customers in using our platform in the best possible way.
* Implement data security and privacy best practices - with the support of our security and privacy experts.


**Who You Are:**
* Proven experience as a Data/Software Engineer or in a similar data-heavy role.
* Knowledge of, or some experience with developing services and applications on, cloud solutions such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
* Currently, we have most of our services running on the JVM with the main programming languages being Scala, and Kotlin – being familiar with and able to code using a JVM language (Kotlin/Java/Scala) is needed.
* At least a Bachelor’s degree or similar relevant work experience in a quantitative field such as computer science, informatics, applied mathematics, or statistics
* Good communication skills with fluency in English.


**Nice to have:**
* Some hands-on experience with some of the state-of-the-art big data technologies, such as Kafka, Flink, and/or Spark.
* Programming in Python.
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform.
* Familiarity with DevOps, concurrent/multithreaded programming, or distributed systems are all advantageous.
* Any experience serving on-call for any production systems.
* Interest in having an impact on our organization by keeping cross-team dependencies and relationships in mind when engineering solutions.


**Why Join Us?**
* A high degree of influence in shaping and developing your role further.
* A creative and up-to-date environment that offers great learning opportunities and active engineering communities.
* Flexible working hours and a hybrid work mode, with offices in Oslo and Stockholm.
* International environment with colleagues from around the globe.
* Comprehensive health insurance and wellness offers.
* Insider access to premium news and podcasts.


**Our Interview Process:**
* Recruiter screening (30 min): An initial call with a talent acquisition partner or the team's manager. We’ll tell you a bit about us, answer any questions you may have, learn about your background and what you’re looking to do.
* Home assignment and code review (60 min): a take-home exercise with a follow-up discussion where you meet two of our engineers. We will provide preparation material and context beforehand. The time commitment for completing the home assignment is not more than 3 hours of work.
* Values interview (30 min): meeting the Engineering Manager and Product Manager of the team for a short discussion, such as figuring out whether you’d enjoy being a teammate focusing on your previous experiences as a teammate in various situations.
* Offer extended! If you are interested in talking to more potential coworkers or have additional questions, we will also arrange any additional chats for you.

title: (Senior) Data Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
**Everything we do, starts with you.** 
 Together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. To enable everyone’s future financial growth.
   

  

**We are looking for a**
**Senior Azure Cloud Engineer (m/f/d)**
**(unlimited, fulltime) Join our team at our location in Oslo, Berlin, Verl or Baden-Baden – flexible working conditions available**
 We are a leading fintech company dedicated to revolutionizing the way data is managed, analyzed, and utilized. Our innovative cloud-based solutions empower organizations to harness the full potential of their data to drive business growth and innovation. We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Azure Cloud Engineer to join our dynamic team and lead our cloud data platform initiatives.
   

  

 As the Senior Azure Cloud Engineer (m/f/d) you will play a pivotal role in architecting, implementing, and maintaining our cloud data platform on Microsoft Azure. You will technically lead a team of talented engineers, providing technical guidance and mentorship, while also collaborating with stakeholders to define and execute a roadmap for our cloud data platform. This position requires deep expertise in Azure cloud technologies, strong leadership skills, and a passion for driving innovation in data management and analytics.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities:**
* Professionally leading a technical team of Azure cloud engineers in designing, implementing, and managing our cloud data platform on Microsoft Azure
* Provide technical guidance to team members, fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous learning
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define requirements, architect solutions, and prioritize initiatives for the cloud data platform
* Develop and maintain technical documentation, including architecture diagrams, design documents, and best practices guides
* Lead the implementation of DevOps practices, utilizing tools such as Azure DevOps, Git, and Terraform to automate deployment, scaling, and monitoring of cloud infrastructure
* Design and implement data pipelines using Azure Data Factory and Databricks
* Optimize performance, scalability, and cost-effectiveness of the cloud data platform, leveraging Azure services and best practices
* Implement security and compliance controls to ensure the integrity and confidentiality of data stored in the cloud platform
* Stay abreast of emerging technologies and trends in cloud computing, data management, and analytics, and evaluate their potential impact on our platform


**Your Qualifications:**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
* 5+ years of experience in designing, implementing, and managing cloud-based solutions on Microsoft Azure
* Proven experience in leading technical teams, with a focus on coaching, mentoring, and fostering collaboration
* Deep expertise in Azure cloud services, including but not limited to Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure DevOps, Azure SQL Database, and Azure Resource Manager
* Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python and SQL, with experience in building and optimizing data pipelines and analytics solutions
* Experience with infrastructure-as-code tools such as Terraform for provisioning and managing cloud infrastructure
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders
* Exceptional communication skills in English, both written and verbal, German is a plus
* Azure certifications (e.g. Azure Solutions Architect, Azure DevOps Engineer) are a plus


 #EUR12
   

  

**Benefits:**
* At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
* Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
* Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
* Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
* With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**About Kambi**
 Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.
   

  

 Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.
   

  

**About Tzeract:**
 Tzeract is a pioneering sports betting AI pricing company, operating as an agile startup within the larger ecosystem of Kambi Group ( https://kambi.com/ ). Our mission is to revolutionize the sports betting industry by leveraging cutting-edge technology and advanced analytics to enable the next generation of sports betting experiences. With a focus on both historical and real-time sports data, we're building systems that outperform the market and deliver value to our users.
   

  

 To know more about us - https://tzeract.com/
   

  

**Role Overview:**
 We're seeking a seasoned
 **Senior Software Engineer** 
 with expertise in Python, AWS, and microservices architecture, experienced in developing high-transaction systems. This role is vital for leading the design and development of our technology stack, ensuring our systems can handle the scale and speed required by our operations. You'll collaborate with a cross-functional team to build resilient, efficient, and secure solutions that support our data-driven decision-making processes.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Design, develop, and maintain scalable and resilient microservices using Python and AWS technologies.
* Deep understanding and experience of Rust or Go is a plus.
* Lead initiatives to architect high-transaction systems capable of managing the volume and velocity of our data.
* Implement best practices in software engineering, including CI/CD, containerization, and automated testing to ensure quality and speed of deployments.
* Collaborate with data engineers and scientists to integrate AI models and algorithms into production systems efficiently.
* Mentor junior engineers, fostering a culture of technical excellence and innovation.
* Stay ahead of the curve on new technologies, methodologies, and industry trends, applying them to improve our systems and processes.


**Qualifications:**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
* 5+ years of software development experience, with a strong background in Python.
* Proven track record of developing and maintaining high-transaction, scalable systems.
* Extensive experience with AWS services and managing cloud-based infrastructure.
* Solid understanding of microservices architecture and container orchestration tools (e.g., Kubernetes).
* Experience with DevOps tools and practices, including Docker, Jenkins, or similar.
* Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to lead projects and collaborate effectively across teams.
* Passion for sports and sports betting is a plus.


**Why Join Us:**
* Lead cutting-edge projects that are shaping the future of the sports betting industry.
* Work within a fast-paced, innovative environment that values your ideas and encourages growth.
* Competitive compensation package, including stock options, comprehensive health benefits, and flexible work arrangements.
* A culture that is passionate about technology, innovation, and sports.


**How to Apply:**
 Submit your resume, a brief cover letter outlining your experience with high-transaction systems and why you're interested in this role, and any relevant code samples or project links to us.
   

  

 We're excited to see how you can contribute to our team's success!
   

  

 #wearekambi
   

  

**Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace**
 If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.
   

  

**Creating an inclusive environment**
 We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.
   

  

 #wearekambi

title: Finnish Sales Development Representative
description:
****JOB DESCRIPTION****
**Finnish Sales Development Representative - Solna Office**
 Oracle is a technology leader that’s changing how the world does business. Kick-start your future in a customer-centric role that gives you real responsibility, access to industry-leading experts, and an incredible learning experience. We want you to develop new business opportunities in the Finnish market, working from our Solna Office. Helps us create the future.

* A competitive salary with exciting benefits
* Flexible and remote working to suit your needs
* Health insurance and pension contributions
* Annual leave of 30 days with the option to buy more
* Mentorship and training programs to advance your career
* Annual education budget to spend on career development

title: OiT-237 Data Classification and Labeling Analyst
description:
**WSP** 
 is a global consulting firm assisting public and private clients to plan, develop, design, construct, operate and maintain thousands of critical infrastructure projects around the world.
   

  

**Position Summary**
 We are seeking a meticulous and detail-oriented Data Classification and Labeling Analyst to join our Security Engineering and Operations team. The successful candidate will be responsible for accurately classifying and labeling large datasets to support our machine learning and data analysis initiatives.
   

  

**A day in the life**
 Specific areas of responsibility may fall into any one of the following areas of Data Classification and Labeling:
   

  

* Refine data discovery, classification, and labelling requirements (e.g., data sources, data/file types, integrations)
* Develop Internal Data Process / Placement Mapping
* Define classification and labelling schema and lifecycle handling policies
* Identify gaps in current solution (e.g., MS Purview) identify additional tooling required
* Select, implement, and configure solution to scan, map, classify, and label WSP’s data holdings
* Configure solution to enable automated and manual sensitive data labelling for M365 apps and services (incl. configuring mail flow rules)
* Prioritize and onboard data sources for scanning (e.g., structured, unstructured data across applications, databases, file shares, cloud storage)
* Execute scans, build data maps, and tune classifications
* Develop policies and procedures to communicate, operationalize, and sustain discovery, classification, and labelling capabilities


**Leadership And People Responsibilities**
* Develop positive working relationships with other team members and business partners and partners across teams to align with WSPs internal and external client demands.
* Provide feedback on the governance process for continued improvement.


  

  

**Finance/Budgetary Responsibilities**
* Provide feedback on tooling and identify additional needs
* Plan for expanse of security tools to cover ongoing needs
* Evaluation of license usage and potential growth


**What You’ll Bring To WSP**
* 7-+ years related experience in data management or similar position.
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, data sciences, or related field
* Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (purview). Familiarity with machine learning concepts is a plus.
* Strong analytical skills with a keen eye for detail and accuracy.
* Experience with IT Governance frameworks such as COBIT, ITIL and ISO 2700x, NIST
* Experience with governance, compliance, and audit within IT environments
* Experience of risk management, including risk analysis, mitigation, and monitoring
* Knowledge of information security regulations applicable to WSP


  

  

**What Sets You Apart**
* Master's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, data sciences, or related field
* Microsoft data analyst associate certification, Data+ or equivalent


**Contact**
 For questions, please contact Hiring Manager, Matthew Groff (matthew.groff@wsp.com)

title: Senior Technical Specialist - Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
 We are looking for a Senior SOC Analyst who will join our Security Operations Center.
   

  

**Role Overview:**
 As a SOC Analyst, you'll be an integral part of our team, responsible for identifying, analyzing, and mitigating cybersecurity incidents to ensure our clients' digital environments are secure and resilient.
   

  

**Job Description**
* Ensure the continuous monitoring and review of security event sources for alerts and incidents.
* Use SOC security analytic tools, technologies and services (SIEM, SOAR, EDR etc).
* Perform investigations of security incidents,
* Perform threat Intelligence and threat hunting, to search for new, emerged and wildly exploited threats.
* Develop automation of our detection capabilities.
* Manage and maintain security event monitoring use cases, including ruleset configuration for the deployed toolset.
* Report and participate in process development
* Actively proposing changes or improvements of products/services and.


**Requirements**
 We expect you to have some years of working experience in cybersecurity, as a security analyst or incident responder.
   

  

**A Swedish citizenship as we have some Swedish security elevated customers**
 Excellent knowledge of the English language, both spoken and written
   

  

**Qualifications**
 We do also expect you to have previous experience within some of the following areas:
   

  

* Networking technologies (Firewalls, Next-Gen Firewalls, Switches, Routers)
* Endpoint protection (Antivirus / EDR)
* Cloud security knowledge
* Intrusion detection and prevention systems (IPS/IDS sensors)
* Security Information and Event Management (SIEM platforms)
* Vulnerability scanning
* Penetration testing / Ethical hacking
* Scripting languages


 We consider it meritorious if you have any cybersecurity or it operations related certificates
   

  

**As a person you are:**
 A team player who is also capable of working with independent tasks. You have a passion for IT and especially for security. With us, you will have the opportunity to directly influence your career development and the future of our SOC. We value good ideas and implement these. We believe that trust fosters freedom and creativity. Our culture is built on transparency and active sharing – a truly open environment.
   

  

**Are you interested?** 
  

  

 We look forward your application!
   

  

 Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we’ll reach out to you. Interviews will be held on continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today.
   

  

*We perform background checks on all final candidates.*
*Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*
**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry is one of the leading companies in the Nordics building better digital services for our clients both on private and public sectors. With us, you are part of the forefront of emerging businesses and technology making the difference with our customers. Cooperate and exchange ideas with professionals in an international and evolving working environment. Increase your knowledge in a variety of areas, you set the limit. Our culture is built on transparency and active sharing – a truly open environment.
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: PLM Specialist - Eviden
description:
Eviden, part of the Atos Group, with an annual revenue of circa € 5 billion is a global leader in data-driven, trusted and sustainable digital transformation. As a next generation digital business with worldwide leading positions in digital, cloud, data, advanced computing and security, it brings deep expertise for all industries in more than 47 countries. By uniting unique high-end technologies across the full digital continuum with 47,000 world-class talents, Eviden expands the possibilities of data and technology, now and for generations to come.
   

  

 To meet the increasing demand for skilled people in the PLM domain we are searching for new colleagues. We cater to a wide range of customers within discrete manufacturing, heavy machinery, defense & aerospace, and automotive. For this role, you will be able to work on projects across the Nordics as well as international projects across Europe.
   

  

 We are known for our unmatched expertise leading to long partnerships and high happiness of our clients – often described as a customer for life -attitude. We are proudly serving over 400 customers from large enterprises to fast-growing start-ups in the Nordic & Baltic countries. The work location for the role can be: Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland
   

  

 Does that sound like the perfect career opportunity for you? If yes, do not hesitate to apply and become part of our team.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Implementation of functionality in Teamcenter based on specifications
* Configuration of PLM. PLM Use case- and process creation and definition within one or more areas
* Workshop facilitation
* BOM Management. Change Management
* Supplier Collaboration
* Requirements Management. Design Data Management
* Program & Project Management. Service Lifecycle Management
* Manufacturing Engineering
* Quality Management
* Integrations, Functional Design, hands-on concepting, and piloting of design


****Required Capabilities:****
* Degree in Mechanical and/or Manufacturing Engineering, Computer Science, Technology, or equivalent knowledge of PLM.
* Knowledge of manufacturing industry processes in the in PLM domain
* Experience from implementation- configuration- or architectural work for PLM
* Hands-on Knowledge of Siemens Teamcenter & Active Workspace is an advantage


****What We Offer:****
* Flexibility and work-from-home policy
* International teamwork & collaboration
* Work closely with executive management
* Have a positive impact on the organization
* Possibility to work abroad with international clients


 We offer an opportunity to work with leading manufacturing companies from different industries. With us, you will part of a successful team crafting meaningful impact for industrial companies in their Industry 4.0-related and other manufacturing initiatives in Northern Europe. We offer a competitive salary, extended health insurance, and additional local and country-specific benefits depending on your place of work. Most of all, you will get excellent supportive colleagues who will be working with you for our shared success! We offer the culture and look-and-feel of a small company combined with the support and career opportunities of a global IT company!
   

  

 We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

title: Project Engineer
description:
SUMMARY OF THE ROLE:

Do you excel at solving even the most challenging of problems? At Mammoet we set the bar high in developing the safest, most efficient solutions for our customer’s needs. With the team’s experience, we know how to use our heavy lifting and transport equipment to create the best solution for any type of project. Heavy lifting and transport is often a combination of different types of equipment and disciplines, like jacking and skidding, mooring, and ballasting operations. Stability calculations, both static and dynamic, are also part of the engineering. Within Mammoet you are the link between the (technical) preparation and implementation of a project.
WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING:

Your primary tasks will be:* Take owner-ship over the task at hand and align scope with Project Managers and Lead Engineers involved in the project
* Developing the most optimal operational and cost effective transport solution
* Look for creative solutions using existing equipment from our own fleet as a basis
* Make the necessary plans/calculation using various software packages like: AutoCAD and in-house developed software
* Make the strength verification calculations of the required material / equipment
* When needed, attending project location to provide on-site engineering support


WHAT YOU’LL NEED:

We would like you to have technical experience in understanding operation and equipment, but most importantly, you have an interest in this. We imagine that you :* English and Swedish, fluent proficiency verbal and written.
* 0-3 years of relevant experience
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in mechanical engineering, Marine Engineering, Civil Engineering or Automotive
* Have a valid driver's license


WHAT YOU’LL GET:

You will be based in our office in Kungälv. We offer an open and appreciative work environment, where we have respect for each other's knowledge and professionalism.

* A dynamic working environment, identical projects do not exist
* Challenging your analytical skills and providing freedom to develop out-of-the-box engineering solutions
* An informal and supportive working environment
* Being in control of your Mammoet career, in but also outside the engineering department
* International traveling and dealing with a variety of cultures


WANT TO KNOW MORE?:  

* Take a look at mammoet.com

title: System Engineer - Automation and Controls
description:
***At Prevas, we lead the way in innovative solutions, making technology work for our clients. We are looking for a System Engineer - Automation and Controls to join our dynamic team and help craft the future of automation.***

**Role Overview**
-----------------


As a System Engineer specialising in Automation and Controls, you will be at the forefront of designing and implementing high-tech control systems. Your primary duty will involve building, testing, and maintaining automation systems that enhance efficiency and functionality across a variety of industrial applications. A typical day could see you collaborating with multidisciplinary teams, engaging in client consultations, or optimising existing systems to drive performance benefits or develop complete new automation systems..

### **Key Responsibilities**

* Design, develop, and maintain cutting-edge automation and control systems.
* Analyse system requirements and recommend solutions aligned with client needs.
* Perform regular diagnostics and troubleshooting to ensure optimal system performance.
* Create comprehensive documentation and reports for technical specifications and project milestones.
* Collaborate with software and hardware engineers to integrate solutions effectively.

#### **Who You Are**


We believe you are a detail-oriented engineer with a passion for innovation in automation technology. You bring a solid engineering background and a knack for problem-solving, making you adept at overcoming technical challenges. A forward-thinking professional, you recognise that effective engineering solutions require both creativity and precision.

##### **Required Qualifications**

* Masters degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Proven experience in automation and control systems design and implementation.
* Strong knowledge of PLC programming and HMI/SCADA systems.
* Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work collaboratively within cross-functional teams.
* Ability to travel globally for longer periods of time.

###### **Why Join Us**


At Prevas, we offer you not just a job, but an opportunity to grow and make a tangible impact in a setting that values innovation and team spirit. You will have access to continuous learning opportunities, a supportive network of colleagues, and a culture that thrives on creativity and collaboration. Here, your expertise and ambitions find a home where they can truly flourish.


Excited to make a difference with us? Apply now and become a part of a company dedicated to paving the way in sustainable and revolutionary automation solutions.


For more information or to discuss the role informally, feel free to contact:


Emmelie Dahlin  

HR Specialist Rekrytering & Employer Branding  

+ 46 72 14 77 245  

emmelie.dahlin@prevas.se

  

Follow us on **LinkedIn** to learn more about our innovative projects and culture.

title: Praktikant till säljteamet i Göteborg
description:
Urval sker löpande Göteborg Arbete på plats
  
  

Bli vår nästa stjärnpraktikant på ett av Nordens ledande CRM-bolag i hjärtat av Göteborg!
  
  

Är du en driven, kreativ och nyfiken person som vill kickstarta din karriär inom försäljning? Nu har du chansen att praktisera hos oss på Lime och bli en del av vårt energirika säljteam i Göteborg.
  
  

**Vad vi erbjuder:**  

**Hands-on erfarenhet:** Du får möjlighet att arbeta med marknadssegmentering, prospektering, konkurrensanalys och ROI-analys. Dessutom kommer du att få hjälpa till med att bearbeta kunder via e-post.
  
**Ett välkomnande team:** På vårt kontor på Avenyn möts du av en öppen, inbjudande och kreativ arbetsmiljö där samarbete och gemenskap står i centrum. Vi har flexibla arbetsytor och gemensamma fikastunder som ger utrymme för att umgås och knyta kontakter.
  
**Utmanande projekt:** Vi har många spännande idéer för hur vi vill utveckla vårt säljarbete framåt, och vi vill ha din hjälp att driva dessa projekt till framgång!
  
Några av våra medarbetare
  
Anna-Mari Ewing
  
Sales Operations Specialist
  
"Om du ger uttryck för dina ambitioner och vad du behöver för stöd, så finns det stora möjligheter att utveckla din karriär med oss."
  
Matilda Alm
  
Account Manager
  
"På Lime trivs jag med fantastiska kollegor och en inspirerande kultur. Möjligheterna att utmanas och växa som säljare gör varje dag spännande och unik."
  
Terry Ilebode
  
Software Engineer
  
"Lime ger mig ett holistiskt stöd i alla delar av mitt liv genom att både utmana mig som mjukvaruutvecklare och ge mig stöd i min personliga utveckling."
  
Henrik Kjærvik
  
Head of Expert Services
  
"Det bästa med att jobba på Lime, förutom kollegorna så klart, är flexibiliteten och möjligheterna att utveckla din karriär i linje med dina egna mål och ambitioner."
  
Kvalifikationer
  
  

**Vad vi söker:**  

**Engagemang och initiativförmåga:** Vi letar efter någon som inte är rädd för att ta ägandeskap, komma med egna idéer och alltid sträva efter att göra det lilla extra.
  
**Nyfikenhet på försäljning:** Du är intresserad av en karriär inom försäljning och ser den här praktiken som en möjlighet att växa och lära dig.
  
**Plus i kanten:** Om du har erfarenhet av projektledning eller försäljning är det fantastiskt, men det är inget krav.
  
  

**Varför du borde söka:** Hos oss får du mer än bara en praktikplats – du får möjligheten att djupdyka in i CRM-världen och vässa dina färdigheter inom försäljning och lägga grunden för en framtida karriär.
  
  

Vad mer? Om du briljerar under din praktik kan detta vara början på en spännande resa inom Lime.
  
  

Så, vad väntar du på? Skicka in ditt CV tillsammans med några rader om varför just du är nyfiken på en karriär inom försäljning – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
  
  

/Säljteamet i Göteborg
  
  

Hör av dig till sara.akesson@lime.tech för frågor
  
  

Konferenser och sociala aktiviteter
  
  

Träning och utveckling
  
  

Balans i (jobb)livet
  
  

Kaffe, dricka och fika
  
  

Hälsa och välmående
  
  

Bygga Lime tillsammans
  
  

Om företaget
  
  

Lime är ett börsnoterat techbolag med 9 kontor i 6 länder. Vi växer konstant med ca 20 % per år och öppnade under hösten 2020 vårt första utomnordiska kontor i Nederländerna. Sedan dess har vi äntrat Tyskland och har ständigt ögonen öppna för nya, potentiella marknader. Men det där är bara siffror och fakta. Det riktigt härliga med Lime är vi som jobbar här - ett stort gäng omtänksamma, ambitiösa kollegor som kämpar för en värld där alla kundupplevelser överträffar förväntningarna. Med hjälp av smart teknik och träffsäker expertis förenklar vi kunders vardag och skapar förutsättningar för det där lilla extra. Något som fortfarande är unikt för ett mjukvarubolag som Lime är också att vi sköter hela produktlivscykeln själva - allt från utveckling, till leverans, till support. Vi tar helt enkelt ansvar för att kedjan är hel och välfungerande, med en twist. Vi kallar det #dontbreakthechain.
  
  

Lime grundades av tre studenter i Lund år 1990
  
  

Lime klimatkompenserar genom grön el från en solcellspark utanför Sjöbo
  
  

Lime har gjort sex företagsförvärv sedan år 2017
  
  

Limes nuvarande VD Nils började som en av de första traineerna år 2006
  
  

Lime introducerades på Nasdaq i Stockholm år 2018
  
  

Lime lanserade sitt omvända mentorskapsprogram år 2019
  
  

Limes mjukvara har en räckvidd på ca 100 miljoner människor dagligen
  
  

Sara Pennsäter Åkesson | Kontaktperson
company_description: Looking for a boring employer? Look elsewhere! At Lime, we love customer care, sales and case management! We love to deliver that “something special” – while having a lot of fun along the way.

title: Propulsion System Controls Calibration Engineer
description:
**About Polestar:**


Polestar is a leading electric vehicle (EV) manufacturer focused on innovation, sustainability, and high performance. Our mission is to accelerate the shift to sustainable mobility through advanced engineering and exceptional design. We are looking for talented individuals who share our passion for electric mobility and want to be part of shaping the future of automotive technology.

 **The Opportunity**


We are seeking an experienced Propulsion System Controls Calibration Engineer with deep expertise in Battery Electric Vehicles (BEVs) to join our team in Gothenburg. In this role, you will be responsible for the calibration and fine-tuning of our propulsion control systems, ensuring optimal performance, efficiency, and drivability. This is a crucial position that involves working closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality propulsion systems for our next-generation vehicles.

 **The Responsibilities:**

* **Calibration and Tuning:** Develop, calibrate, and optimize propulsion control systems for BEVs, focusing on performance, efficiency, safety, and compliance with regulatory standards.
* **System Integration:** Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software, hardware, and vehicle integration engineers, to ensure seamless integration of propulsion systems into the vehicle.
* **Data Analysis and Validation:** Conduct extensive data analysis and validation to ensure calibration accuracy. Utilize advanced tools and methodologies to identify and troubleshoot issues, making necessary adjustments to meet performance targets.
* **Testing and Development:** Design and conduct tests for various propulsion components and systems, both in simulation environments and real-world conditions. Participate in vehicle testing activities to validate system performance.
* **Continuous Improvement:** Support continuous improvement efforts by developing and implementing new calibration strategies, methods, and tools to enhance propulsion performance and efficiency.
* **Documentation and Reporting:** Create and maintain comprehensive documentation of calibration procedures, test results, and system performance data. Provide detailed reports to support decision-making processes.
* **Regulatory Compliance:** Ensure all calibration and development activities comply with industry standards and regulations related to safety, emissions, and performance.
* **Mentorship and Collaboration:** Mentor junior engineers and provide technical guidance and support. Foster a collaborative environment to encourage knowledge sharing and innovative problem-solving.

  

**The Ideal Candidate**


We are seeking a professional with technical expertise in calibrating BEV propulsion systems, specifically focused on optimizing performance and efficiency. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills, capable of interpreting complex data sets to develop actionable insights.


Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, are crucial, as you will need to convey technical concepts clearly to cross-functional teams and stakeholders. You should be a team player, able to contribute effectively to a positive team dynamic while fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous improvement.


Lastly, adaptability and initiative are key; you must be willing to embrace changing project requirements and proactively prioritise to address challenges as they arise.


In addition to the above you’ll need:

* **BEV Expertise:** At least 5 years of experience in propulsion controls calibration, with a strong focus on Battery Electric Vehicles (BEVs).
* **Technical Skills:** Proficiency with calibration and data analysis tools such as ETAS INCA or CANape. MATLAB/Simulink, and Vector tools (e.g., CANalyzer, CANoe) desirable but not a must.
* **Systems Knowledge:** Deep understanding of propulsion control systems, including electric motors, inverters, battery management systems (BMS), and control strategies.
* **Testing Experience:** Experience with both in-vehicle and test bench calibration and validation mandatory. Experience with HiL/SiL/MiL testing environments advantageous
* **Educational Background:** Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Automotive Engineering, or a related field.
* **Driving License:** A valid driving license is required.

  

**Why Join Polestar?**


At Polestar, you will be part of a dynamic team committed to pushing the boundaries of what is possible in electric vehicle technology. We offer a stimulating work environment, opportunities for professional growth, and the chance to make a meaningful impact on the future of sustainable mobility.


If you have a passion for electric vehicles and the expertise to excel in this role, we encourage you to apply and join us in driving the shift towards a cleaner, more sustainable future.

title: Consulting Software Test Lead Engineer
description:
WE DEVELOP PEOPLE THAT DEVELOP TECHNOLOGY. JOIN US!
  
We at Quokka see ourselves as individuals with great potential and not only as individuals with a certain competence. When becoming a part of us you will be a part of an exciting journey and join a community that help each other and our customers. At Quokka we are passionate about giving our employees the tools they need to develop both personal and professional, as well as the opportunity to develop Quokka and our future direction. Together we want to build meaningful relationships and technology.
  
QUOKKA - CARE, JOY, CURIOSITY & INNOVATION
  
The Quokka kangaroo is known for its curiosity and for being the happiest animal on the planet. Yes, that is right! We are a newly started technical center in Gothenburg who believe in the “Quokka attitude” and our core values CARE, JOY, CURIOSITY & INNOVATION.
  
We offer technical solutions and engineering services to some of Sweden’s leading companies and recent start-ups. At the same time, we also have an innovation hub to support and encourage our employees and partners to realize their business ideas. A combination which we believe makes us unique on the market.
  
QUOKKA WAY & PERSONALITY
  
We believe in being curious about our surroundings and the people around us. Curious about technology, new challenges and our own development. While being curious in finding new ways forward we believe in being caring and spreading joy. We like to call it the “Quokka Way” of doing things!
  
We are looking for authenticity, kindness, and willingness to share experience and joy. Someone that is engaged and wants to develop and listen to others. We believe that we do this together and your contribution to us, and ours to you, is key in the success.
  
  

**We are now looking for a:**  

Test Leader at Professional Level
  
Oversee the creation and management of software project test plans, as well as plan, organize, and coordinate testing activities for complete system installations involving software testing. Ensure tests are conducted efficiently and validated accurately. Focus on minimizing installation time and optimizing the test cycle efficiency across test objects. Generate valuable data for engineering teams and follow up with relevant activities in testing facilities to establish key performance indicators.
  
T-shaped profile with extensive product knowledge
  
You will be responsible for providing detailed feedback to the development team and Product Leader for each Product Class on any known defects or product limitations. This information must be shared no later than the Release Board meeting for each Release Candidate.
  
You will also manage the fault report process, ensuring that verification of fault reports marked as ready for validation is integrated into the test plan. Collaborate with other locations to optimize global test object usage by coordinating a shared test plan.
  
Logistics and Maintenance
  
Ensure all hardware logistics, procurement of necessary parts, rebuild planning, baseline integrations, and repairs are aligned to maintain the readiness and uptime of test objects, enabling the successful execution of the test plan.
  
Review development milestones and delivery notes, ensuring the test plan remains aligned with key project milestones and relevant activities.
  
Sounds interesting and curious to know some more? Read on!
  
YOUR KNOWLEDGE & EXPERIENCE
  
B.Sc. Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineer or equivalent
  
Minimum 3 years work-experience of electrical system engineering from automotive industry
  
CANalyzer / CANoe systems
  
Proficient skills in Excel
  
Fluent in English (written and spoken)
  
  

WHAT WE OFFER
  
We do have all the basics in place like wellness allowance, pension, insurances, and union agreement. But that is not why you choose us. You want to start working at Quokka because:
  
We are the company that put our employees first
  
We have a corporate culture that is unique
  
You get to be a part of creating something new
  
**You get the best of two worlds:** a start-up and with great financial security
  
We do not believe in hierarchies. We are a flat organization where all voices are equally important
  
  

INTERESTED IN JOINING QUOKKA?
  
The recruitment process take place on an ongoing basis, so do not wait with sending in your application.
  
Apply by sending us your CV and a short presentation to application@quokka.se and let us know what you are interested in working with.
  
We are looking forward to hearing from you!
  
Curious to know some more about Quokka? Check out our website https://www.quokka.se/

title: Postdoktor inom datavetenskap
description:
Ref.nr: 2024/2164


Ansök


Mälardalens universitet (MDU) är Sveriges nyaste universitet. Med vår vision, att vara ett progressivt och samverkande universitet där vi tillsammans formar en hållbar framtid, vill vi göra verklig skillnad.  

  

Vill du vara med och bidra till vår utveckling?  

  

Tillsammans bidrar vi till en mer hållbar framtid genom kunskap och innovation. Vi anser att ny kunskap och nya perspektiv bäst skapas och uppnås i samverkan med andra - kollegor, studenter, näringsliv och offentlig sektor såväl nationellt som internationellt.  

  

På akademin för innovation, design och teknik läser våra studenter bland annat till datavetare, innovatörer, entreprenörer, informationsdesigners, nätverkstekniker och ingenjörer. Hos oss finns forskningsinriktningarna inbyggda system och innovation och produktrealisering. Vi har ett stort antal internationella samarbeten både inom forskning och utbildning, samt i samverkan och i strategiska avtal med företag, organisationer och myndigheter i regionen.


**Anställningsinformation**
---------------------------



Anställningsform: Tidsbegränsad anställning  

Omfattning: Heltid  

Antal anställningar: 1  

Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-10-08  

Stationeringsort: Västerås  

Akademi: Akademin för innovation, design och teknik (IDT)


**Arbetsuppgifter**
-------------------



En anställning som postdoktor syftar till att efter avlagd doktorsexamen ge en möjlighet att utveckla sin självständighet som forskare och skapa förutsättningar för vidare meritering. Anställningen kan vara tidsbegränsad under maximalt 3 år.



Anställningen är en del av delprojektet “Collaborative Cross-domain Software Architecting” i det Vinnova-finansierade kompetenscentret CoDig (Continuous Digitalization) och i samarbete med Software Center. Forskningen kommer utföras i nära samarbete med samarbetspartners från industrin.



Som postdoktor kommer du att arbeta med forskning inom kollaborativt programvaruarkitekturarbete över flera domäner, till exempel att underlätta övergripande analys på produktnivå med minimala ändringar i hur olika heterogena delsystem utvecklas. Inledningsvis kommer arbetet fokusera på att förstå nuläget och de specifika utmaningar som företagen står inför, med ett specifikt fokus på att fånga upp god praxis. Även undervisningsuppgifter, exempelvis som kursassistent, kan förekomma till en omfattning om max 20%.


**Behörighetskrav**
-------------------



Vi söker dig som har avlagt en doktorsexamen i datavetenskap***,*** senast tre år före ansökningstidens utgång. Du har inte tidigare haft en anställning som postdoktor inom samma eller närliggande ämnesområde vid MDU som överstiger ett år.



Du har erferenhet av forskning inom modellbaserad utveckling samt erfarenhet av akademisk forskning i nära samverkan med industrin. Tjänsten kräver bra förmåga att kommunicera både muntligt och skriftligt på engelska.


**Bedömningsgrunder**
---------------------



För den här anställningen är det meriterande om du har erfarenhet av forskning inom kollaborativ programvaruutveckling, programvaruarkitektur och/eller modellkonsistens.



Vid en samlad bedömning av lämplighet läggs även vikt vid personliga förmågor. Alla anställda vid MDU förväntas samarbeta och bemöta kollegor och studenter med respekt, ta ansvar för verksamheten och de egna arbetsuppgifterna samt bidra till en god arbetsmiljö. För att lyckas i den här rollen ser vi att du är initiativtagande och självständig.



Vi värdesätter de kvaliteter som en jämn ålders- och könsfördelning samt etnisk och kulturell mångfald tillför verksamheten.


**Ansökan**
-----------



Du gör din ansökan genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök” nedan.



De vetenskapliga publikationer som du inte har möjlighet att bifoga i ansökan i digital form skickas per post till:



Mälardalens universitet  

HR-sektionen  

Ref.nr: 2024/2164  

Box 883
  

721 23 Västerås



Du som sökande ansvarar för att ansökan är komplett i enlighet med annonsen och universitetet tillhanda senast sista ansökningsdag.



Välkommen med din ansökan!



Fackliga representanter:



Saco-S saco-s@mdu.se  

Susanne Meijer ST-OFR/S, tel: 021-10 14 89



Vi undanber oss all kontakt med försäljare av annonser. Vi har gjort våra strategiska val för denna rekrytering.



#LI-DNI


### **Kontaktpersoner**


Jan Carlson


Professor i datavetenskap


021-151722


jan.carlson@mdu.se


Radu Dobrin


Avdelningschef/Head of Division


021-10 73 56


radu.dobrin@mdu.se

title: Product minded senior C# .Net core engineer
description:
**Bitlog is a leading player in modern warehouse management, revolutionizing the industry since 2006 with our groundbreaking SaaS solution. Our flagship product, Bitlog WMS, is a warehouse management system equipped with state-of-the-art functionality designed to meet the evolving needs of companies focused on warehousing and distribution. Bitlog has contributed to the great success of e-retailers and distributors in Scandinavia, and today, we count some of the most successful e-retailers and distributors among our clients, such as Nordic Nest, Hultafors Group, Apohem, and Matsmart.**

 **The Engineering Department**


The engineering department consists of a total of 15 people spread across different teams. The teams are focusing on customer value and end results, collectively contributing to problem discovery and solution design. We love to meet at our nice Kista office every now and then, but everyone works where they are most productive, home or office.

**Company and Job Description**


At Bitlog, we are on a mission is to empower distribution businesses with our innovative and user-friendly software solutions. We have very ambitious growth target the coming years and want to significantly grow our customer base. To achieve this ambitious goal, we're looking for a talented developer who not only excels in writing exceptional code but also understands the importance of aligning technical solutions with our evolving business needs.


In this role, you won't just be a developer—you'll be a key player driving the future of Bitlog. Your work will directly impact our customers and the trajectory of our business. If you're excited about creating cutting-edge solutions and being at the forefront of innovation, we want you on our team.


**Why Join Us**

* **Innovate:** work on new and exciting products that push the boundaries of technology.
* **Impact:** play a crucial role in shaping the success of our customers and the future of Bitlog.
* **Grow:** be part of a dynamic team where your ideas and contributions matter

**Key Responsibilities**

* Design, develop, and maintain scalable microservices architecture using C# and .Net.
* Utilize message brokers (e.g., RabbitMQ, Kafka) for efficient communication between microservices.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and deliver high-quality software solutions.
* Mentor and guide junior engineers, fostering a culture of learning and growth.

**Requirements**

* Extensive experience in C# and .Net development.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* A product-minded approach, with a focus on delivering value to customers.


Ready to make a difference? Join us and let’s build something extraordinary products together.
